{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3464220,"name":"NickRandom","username":"NickRandom","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/cc9497/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T05:24:26.307Z","cooked":"

We have just in the last week or so had time to try the beta version of WPILib for 2025 and we are having a few more problems that usual. I realise that it is just a beta version, but build season is not far away and so I assume it is not going to change too much from here. We do use C++ and perhaps it does not get as much testing as Java.

We basically have two big problems:

  1. Building C++ is always a bit slow and in my experience robot code is particularly bad. However, this year the performance seems to have fallen off a cliff. I often get build times of over 10 minutes for a single configuration and more importantly it locks up the whole Windows interface for minutes at a time. I have not experienced that behaviour for about 20 years and I’m not even sure how it is possible. Using Ctrl-Alt-Del to get up Task Manager, does not work. I think I may only get the lockup if doing the build via Simulate Robot Code, but I don’t see how that would be relevant. Is is possible to limit the CPU usage when building C++ code in WPILib?
  2. We use the shuffleboard pretty heavily (9 tabs with quite a lot of controls set up in code). We have often found it to be a bit flakey, for example some or all values not updating and require one or more restarts to come good, but this year it seems much worse than previously. In particular, we are seeing,
  • Widgets not appearing at all.
  • Widgets with numerical values appearing as a Network Table Tree, rather that just as a TextView (this can be fixed by using .WithWidget(), but that was never previously necessary).
  • Huge latency when updating. For example, a text view and graph showing a value that is zero when disabled is clearly taking around a second to update as the robot is enabled/disabled. This is only occuring with the robot and not in simulation. Driving the robot is not laggy at all.

I would love to hear if anyone has been having similar problems, or has any idea what to do about them. I’m happy to provide more information if that helps. Technical answers are fine. I have built my own copy of the shuffleboard from the source, but debugging the issues myself is probably going to take more time than I have available without some guidance.

I’m also interested if there is a better forum to be asking this question.

BTW Some of the Shuffleboard issues are definitely caused by the fact that it has a huge memory leak if graph widgets are used, but even with no graph widgets we still have strange behaviour.

I think I may only get the lockup if doing the build via Simulate Robot Code, but I don’t see how that would be relevant. Is is possible to limit the CPU usage when building C++ code in WPILib?

Hi, we have been experiencing the same issue when trying to build our code with the 2025 beta, for us it even got my laptop to get the blue screen of death a two times. At first I just thought it was my laptop, due to my desktop being able to build the code but still takes longer than it should. It happened anytime we tried to build the code either in sim or just the build command.

NickRandom:

We have often found it to be a bit flakey, for example some or all values not updating and require one or more restarts to come good, but this year it seems much worse than previously. In particular, we are seeing,

For this issue I would recommend just using another dashboard like Elastic which is now included with WPILib.

I will be trying that flag to see how it goes, but not sure it would help with compile times, which were not that bad on the 2024 version.

Well, this doesn’t give us much time to fix it… kickoff is in 7 days. In the future, please test beta releases sooner if you plan on doing so.

NickRandom:

Building C++ is always a bit slow and in my experience robot code is particularly bad. However, this year the performance seems to have fallen off a cliff.

Could you provide a link to your code? We made more stuff in wpimath constexpr, but I specifically checked it didn’t increase compilation time on GCC. MSVC could be different, especially in debug mode. I need to know what code to look at specifically because there’s a lot.

Eigen’s assembly codegen takes the longest during compilation, but that only happens for functions that are actually used.

What version of MSVC do you have installed?

What are your computer specs (processor, RAM, SSD, etc)?

How long does it take to compile the SwerveDrivePoseEstimator example (this is probably the most complex of the examples)? Does it show the same lockup issues? I only see a small decrease in compile speed from 2024 to 2025 with this example, and after a clean it’s about 40 seconds for me.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-12-28T06:31:59.634Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":37.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":477451,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems/477451/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3464234,"name":"NickRandom","username":"NickRandom","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/cc9497/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T06:32:40.202Z","cooked":"
spacey_sooty:

when running gradlew build you can use --max-workers to prevent Gradle from eating all your system resources. See this page for more info Command-Line Interface Reference

Thanks! This is a brillant tip. I just tried a clean build with desktop support and for 4 workers the CPU didn’t get to 100% (50-90%). The build time increased from 9m 14s to 12m 2s, which is not too much. I think I’ll also experiment with the --priority option as well. That might be an even better solution as the build should run at 100% CPU, but just not interfere with whatever I’m doing in the foreground.

The other issue is that the standard WPILib build commands do all configurations, which is usually unnecessary and so just wastes time. I need to spend the time to configure VS Code to easily build just the configurations I need. (When developing code I almost always just use WPILib: Simulate Robot Code because it only builds the one configuration it needs.)

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-12-28T06:32:40.202Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":32.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":477451,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems","display_username":"NickRandom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32158,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6996 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems/477451/6","custom_user_title":"6996 Software Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3464235,"name":"Jade","username":"spacey_sooty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/spacey_sooty/{size}/256378_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T06:35:12.193Z","cooked":"
NickRandom:

The other issue is that the standard WPILib build commands do all configurations, which is usually unnecessary and so just wastes time

This is caused by how Gradle works. When you run gradlew build your saying I want to build everything. There are commands to only build specific configurations, if you run gradlew tasks you’ll be able to find them.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-12-28T06:35:12.193Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":25.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":477451,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems","display_username":"Jade","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60214,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4788 | Choreo | PhotonVision"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems/477451/7","custom_user_title":"4788 | Choreo | PhotonVision","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3464236,"name":"NickRandom","username":"NickRandom","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/cc9497/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T06:36:47.450Z","cooked":"
Leyva:

For this issue I would recommend just using another dashboard like Elastic which is now included with WPILib.

I did try Elastic, but we layout all out widgets in code, which they have depricated. We find that layout is code is very useful and I don’t want to give it up if possible. However, I think we will have to do the work to use it because it instantly feels much more stable.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-12-28T06:36:47.450Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":120,"readers_count":119,"score":29.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":477451,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems","display_username":"NickRandom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32158,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6996 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems/477451/8","custom_user_title":"6996 Software Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3464238,"name":"NickRandom","username":"NickRandom","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/cc9497/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T06:41:20.086Z","cooked":"
calcmogul:

Well, this doesn’t give us much time to fix it… kickoff is in 7 days. In the future, please test beta releases sooner if you plan on doing so.

Sorry. I appreciate your point. This is the first season that we have managed to try the beta at all, so we are on an upwards trajectory. We’ll try to do better next year.

I’m happy to provide code, but that will take me a moment and it is nearly dinner time were I live and the family and calling.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-12-28T06:41:20.086Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":118,"readers_count":117,"score":23.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":477451,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems","display_username":"NickRandom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32158,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6996 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems/477451/9","custom_user_title":"6996 Software Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3464239,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T06:41:50.960Z","cooked":"
NickRandom:

I did try Elastic, but we layout all out widgets in code, which they have depricated.

Unfortunately, Shuffleboard isn’t well-maintained at this point, hence why we bundle Elastic now. To address that use case, Elastic 2025.0.0 beta 5 lets you deploy a .json that defines your layout.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-12-28T06:44:36.088Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":28.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":477451,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems","display_username":"Tyler Veness","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/Gold872/elastic-dashboard/releases/tag/v2025.0.0-beta-5","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Release Elastic 2025.0.0 Beta 5 · Gold872/elastic-dashboard · GitHub","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems/477451/10","custom_user_title":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3464242,"name":"NickRandom","username":"NickRandom","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/cc9497/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T06:49:48.699Z","cooked":"
Joe_Ross:

What version of MSVC do you have installed?

What are your computer specs (processor, RAM, SSD, etc)?

I’m using Visual Studio 2022 17.10.4. From the about box the C++ is Visual C++ 2022 00482-90000-00000-AA862 Microsoft Visual C++ 2022.

Computer specs:

  • Intel(R) Core™ i7-6700K CPU @ 4.00GHz
  • 16GB Ram
  • 512GB SSD
  • Windows 10

Results are also similar on my new Windows 11 laptop. I’ll build the SwerveDrivePoseEstimator example and report later. Note that the lockup was intermittant (but spectacular).

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-12-28T06:49:48.699Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":27.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":477451,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems","display_username":"NickRandom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32158,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6996 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems/477451/11","custom_user_title":"6996 Software Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3464250,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T07:34:59.778Z","cooked":"

calcmogul:

Could you provide a link to your code? We made more stuff in wpimath constexpr, but I specifically checked it didn’t increase compilation time on GCC. MSVC could be different, especially in debug mode. I need to know what code to look at specifically because there’s a lot.

I’ve run a few tests of 2024 versus 2025 build times for our code. These are for both my older desktop machine (Windows 10) and somewhat newer laptop (Windows 11), but the relative results are fairly similar. The times are for a build directly after having done a clean, and I rejected times if there was any updating of libraries etc. Note that the for the old machine the code I’m building is actually on a magnetic disk, rather than the C:, which is an SSD (I forgot that in my post above).

The ‘Full’ build is with desktop support enabled and the ‘Robot’ build is with it disabled. The ‘Desktop’ build is the difference in time between the two, which should roughly be the time taken to build the desktop configurations.

The differences are smaller than I thought they would be, but as you suggested the difference is much greater for the desktop code build with MSVC, rather than GCC.

i7-6700K CPU @ 4.00GHz, 16GB RAM, Magnetic Disk i7-10750H CPU @2.6GHz, 32GB RAM, SSD
Full Robot Desktop Full Robot Desktop
WPILib 2024 5:55 2:05 3:50 4:34 1:41 2:53
WPILib 2025 9:14 2:42 6:32 7:43 2:12 5:31
Increase 56% 30% 70% 69% 31% 91%

Personally, I can live with these times, althought they are not ideal and the effect on students will be greater as they tend to have underpowered, ultralight laptops. I will try to look at our code and see if any optimsation is possible (sometimes optimsation of headers included in headers can help quite a bit).

However, there is still the issue of locking up the UI, but at the moment I don’t know exactly what causes that. Possibly it was only happening when I had the Shuffleboard still running and it had used up half my available RAM. @Leyva did report a similar problem above. If you have any ideas/testing for me to try I’m happy to do that, but otherwise I’ll just monitor whether it keeps happening.

I have uploaded the 2024 and 2025 code I was testing with here, in case you wanted it for testing. This happens to be for our 2023 robot.

github.com

public/2023 at master · TeamKoalafied/public

Public code. Contribute to TeamKoalafied/public development by creating an account on GitHub.

Thanks for your help.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-12-28T12:07:57.319Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":39.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":477451,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems","display_username":"NickRandom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/TeamKoalafied/public/tree/master/2023","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"public/2023 at master · TeamKoalafied/public · GitHub","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32158,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6996 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems/477451/13","custom_user_title":"6996 Software Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3464303,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-28T15:14:01.494Z","cooked":"
NickRandom:

I will try to look at our code and see if any optimsation is possible (sometimes optimsation of headers included in headers can help quite a bit).

One thing that popped out at me was RobotConfiguration.h includes Transform3d.h, which is included basically everywhere and pulls in a lot more headers than it used to due to WPILib changes. Maybe try breaking that constant out to a different file and only pulling that in where it’s actually needed? (Maybe pull out the trapezoid profile as well, but I think that is a lot smaller).

Re: computer lockups, the most common reason for that is thrashing due to OOM. Reducing Gradle worker count will help (reduces number of simultaneous compiler executions), as will this kind of header change (reducing the memory need for most source files). The system with 16 GB of RAM and 8 HT is particularly susceptible to OOM. If each compiler run is taking 1-2 GB, there’s not a lot of headroom if you’re building 8 files at once, especially if Shuffleboard (and vscode, intellisense, Gradle, etc) has already consumed a significant amount. How much free memory do you see before starting the build?

EDIT: Now that the PR mentioned below is merged, you can use development artifacts via allwpilib/DevelopmentBuilds.md at main · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub without having to build allwpilib yourself.

Try this branch: [wpimath] Use ct_matrix instead of <Eigen/LU> for determinant in headers by calcmogul · Pull Request #7600 · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub.

git clone https://github.com/calcmogul/allwpilib -b wpimath-use-ct-matrix-determinant-in-headers
cd allwpilib
./gradlew.bat build --max-workers 8
./gradlew.bat publish

Here’s instructions on how to use the local artifacts in a robot project: allwpilib/DevelopmentBuilds.md at main · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub

I can’t test it myself because I do development entirely on Linux.

NickRandom:

Can you possibly describe how you did that?

This tutorial is pretty close to what I did, without all the missteps from outdated information I found elsewhere. Tutorial: vcperf and Windows Performance Analyzer | Microsoft Learn I didn’t have to do the configure WPA step, as the dll was already in the right place.

I originally couldn’t get WPA to work, so those screenshots are from dragging the etl files to Visual Studio. I later realized that was because the first etl file I created was from a different set of instructions, and doing it per the link above let me open them in WPA also.

NickRandom:

Embarassingly, I ended up building it myself because I could not understand artifactory. I was expecting to see ‘allwpilib’ with a ‘download’ button next to it. If anyone can point me in the right direction That would be great.

You don’t have to download anything from artifactory manually. Just make the changes in that document to your build.gradle and gradle will do it automagically.

FWIW, I booted into linux, and the builds were about 40% faster in Linux then windows on the same computer.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2024-12-29T07:11:40.538Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":18,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":44.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":477451,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/build-insights/tutorials/vcperf-and-wpa?view=msvc-170","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Tutorial: vcperf and Windows Performance Analyzer | Microsoft Learn","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2025-beta-shuffleboard-and-c-build-problems/477451/19","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3464643,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-29T07:24:06.124Z","cooked":"
NickRandom:

However, from your images it looks like precompile headers are still a thing and that is certainly how problems like this used to be solved for MSVC.

We looked at PCHs before and decided not to use them for a few reasons.

  1. Every compiler does it differently, so it’s not portable between MSVC, GCC, and Apple Clang.
  2. Compilers flags between the robot project and PCH must match for the compiler to use the PCH, so we essentially have to generate PCHs on the user’s machine. This is problematic because precompiled uberheaders can take longer to generate and import than just building a translation unit normally.
  3. The build system machinery for keeping precompiled headers up to date is annoying to maintain.
  4. The last time we checked allwpilib’s compilation profile, most of WPILib’s compilation time was spent in the backend rather than the frontend, so PCHs wouldn’t speed our build up much.

C++ modules supposedly work better than PCHs, but build system support is incomplete. MSVC’s is complete, but CMake’s is experimental and has some limitations, and Gradle is never supporting modules. Standard library modules from C++23 aren’t supported everywhere yet either.

We’ve discussed moving to a build system better suited for C++ like CMake or Bazel for 2027, with Java potentially still using Gradle.
